column4: verify both motitors (each at the time) with xserver, establish what mode will you use, and is supported by driver, hook up second sceen.
connect, start system, check available setting (resolution  etc)
do you have ati diver or open?
I have checked what both say, but my 22" led tv that I want to hook up with hdmi is shown as a 7"
with open drivers it is going to be... is randr working with your card?
The resolutions on the hdmi go up tp 1080p and the VGA goes up to 1020*768.
i am afraid that would be max on this driver, if there is ati stuff use it to compare, if not check for randr and twinview on open-source driver.
always you can remove it, also check your tv spec (from manufacturer website) what resolution it shuld support
ok, have you tried to boot into recovery and run failsafex on hdmi?
of try xinit from tty and see what errors come up
first, can you see terminal on hdmi, can you login?
so, when you boot on hdmi what happent (try to hold shift on boot to see grub)
did you try to press Alt-Ctlr-F1 on after it goes blank?
other way press e in grub menu
by the way, try to shche<TAB> when you adress me, I do not have too many colors, so hard to find you.
